item.title: A PS5 & PC Cross-Buy Option Has Been Discovered & Verified
item.content:encoded:
We could finally be getting PS5 & PC cross-buy capabilities as the symbol has been discovered in PlayStation Store data. While it’s not official, the new report means that PlayStation is testing the waters with PS5 & cross-buy, and owners of both platforms could be in for dual-entitlement sooner rather than later.

For the longest time, Xbox and PC owners have been able to enjoy cross-buy purchases. Meaning, you can buy a game on Xbox and also play the title on PC, and vice versa. If a new report is accurate, PC players might be about to get the best of both worlds.

We Could Be Getting PS5 & PC Cross-Buy

News first broke on November 4 that new symbols had been discovered in the PlayStation Store’s files. The initial findings came from X account Amethxst.

They said:

New Symbols will be added soon (website & tool), but here some nice new features from PlayStation (yes, some are old, other are unseen): A kind of “echo mode,” “PS5/PC games,” and “Cross-Buy.”

The message also showed the symbols, what they look like, and it all seemed very real.

It was a big, yet confident statement, but there has been a fair amount of trepidation about the potential claim. However, reliable outlet Dealabs has done some testing into the matter: “We decided to conduct our own investigation on the new symbols discovered, but especially on their date of addition to determine if they are not really old symbols.”

The ever-reliable billbil-kun described how they were “Inserting special characters in the “About” section of our PlayStation Network account. And the result does indeed show that these symbols actually exist.“

More evidence was found on top of this:

Before the addition of these symbols, other clues were present through the PlayStation Store data. In some of the site’s CSS files, we also discovered the mention of “crossbuy-tag” in some properties of the file.

We tried to reproduce this CSS style on text and the result corresponds exactly to the symbol found on consoles. The result is shown in the image below. You can also do the test by yourself through this template created by us on CodePen.”

Would this be a huge coup for PC gamers, and PS5 players, for that matter? Let us know your thoughts and more through the Insider Gaming Discord Server, which is attracting many new users by the day!

IG has much more news for you, including Battlefield 6 Reportedly Selling Over 10 Million Copies, and the Steam Deck Giving Users A Feature They’ve Wanted For Years.

item.title: Terminator 2D: No Fate Delayed
item.content:encoded:
Reef Entertainment has confirmed that Terminator 2D: No Fate has been delayed to December 12, 2025.

Terminator 2D: No Fate has been delayed multiple times since its release date announcement. The game’s release was initially pushed back to October 2025 due to issues with the physical edition. It was then moved to November 2025 due to global trade and tariff changes. Now it has been delayed again due to more physical edition hurdles.

Terminator 2D: No Fate Delayed to December 2025 to Assemble the Physical Editions

The latest delay announcement for Terminator 2D: No Fate has been shared through a post on Reef Entertainment’s official X account (formerly Twitter). The developers have revealed that “physical components for all editions have now finally arrived.” However, they will need some additional time to assemble them, which is why both the physical and digital editions will be available in December. The devs have sincerely apologized for the repeated delays.

For those unaware of the title, Terminator 2D: No Fate is an upcoming 2D platformer featuring pixel graphics that allows players to experience the events of Terminator 2: Judgment Day. You will be able to play as Sarah Connor, John Connor, and the T-800 as they face the full force of Cyberdyne and Skynet’s arsenal, with multiple enemy types and boss fights. The title also features various game modes, including Story Mode, Arcade Mode, Infinite Mode, Boss Rush, Mother of the Future, and Level Training.

In other news, here’s how the T-1000 Terminator looks in Mortal Kombat 1. What are your thoughts on Terminator 2D: No Fate being delayed again? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Minecraft receiving a Dragon Ball Z DLC. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Minecraft Has Received a Surprise Dragon Ball Z DLC
item.content:encoded:
Minecraft has received a Dragon Ball Z DLC out of nowhere, adding Goku, Vegeta, and more to the game with different battle game modes.

Minecraft has been receiving really extensive DLCs lately, which don’t just add cosmetics, but new worlds and gameplay elements to the title. We saw this with the Superman DLC in September, where players could use the Man of Steel’s abilities. Now, the Dragon Ball Z DLC has arrived, and it is receiving a similar treatment.

Minecraft’s Dragon Ball Z DLC Will Let Players Enter Solo, Co-Op, or 5v5 Free For All Showdowns

Minecraft’s Dragon Ball Z DLC is available now to purchase for 1,510 Minecoins on the Minecraft Marketplace. In this DLC, players will receive 11 new characters: Goku, Vegeta, Gohan, Piccolo, Frieza, Trunks, Krillin, Android 18, Cell, Android 17, and Majin Buu. Some of these characters will also have Super Saiyan forms. Moreover, several iconic locations from the popular anime will make their way to the game, too, including Cell Games Arena, World Martial Arts Tournament Arena, Planet Namek, Capsule Corp, and more.

Furthermore, these are not just cosmetics; players will be able to bring out their inner Z warrior with the new Dragon Ball Z DLC for Minecraft. From the trailer, we could see that players will be able to use not only Ki Blasts, but special moves for different characters, including the Kamehameha for Goku, Gallick Gun for Vegeta, Special Beam Canon for Piccolo, and more. Each character brings their own moves, ultimate attacks, and custom VFX.

Two new freebies will be included as well, the first is ‘Become Saiyan’, where players can stay in character inside their “own Minecraft world with this skin pack that includes every famed combatant from Goku, Gohan, and Piccolo, to Vegeta, Bulma, and Frieza.” Second is the Scouter Character Creator item, which makes players look like a member of the Frieza Force.

In other news, A Minecraft Movie has launched a “For Your Consideration” awards campaign. Additionally, a Slipknot member has opened a surreal Minecraft Realm called Vernearth. What are your thoughts on Minecraft’s Dragon Ball Z DLC? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Battlefield 6 reportedly selling over 10 million copies. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Battlefield 6 Has Reportedly Sold Over 10 Million Copies
item.content:encoded:
New data from Alinea Analytics reveals that Battlefield 6 has sold over 10 million copies across all platforms.

Battlefield 6 has taken the gaming world by storm, hitting new heights of player numbers on Steam with both the full release and the battle royale mode. We already knew that BF6 had become the biggest launch in series history, selling over 7 million copies. Now, it seems that the game has reached a brand new sales milestone.

Battlefield 6’s 10 Million Copies May Not Be Enough to “Overturn Call of Duty’s Overall Market Dominance”

Rhys Elliot from Alinea Analystics revealed that Battlefield 6 has surpassed 10 million copies sold across all platforms during a new interview with GameIndustry.Biz. However, he feels that this momentum is not enough to overtake “Call of Duty’s overall market dominance – this year, at least.” Elliot added that Battlefield 6 has gained a lot of popularity amongst the PC players; however, Call of Duty is a “multi-platform powerhouse” whose sales base “extends far beyond Steam and the PC market.”

Elliot explains that Battlefield 6 is experiencing “a huge amount of goodwill” from the community, thanks to all the improvements they have made from the previous title, Battlefield 2042. Call of Duty, on the other hand, is experiencing a “perception problem” due to the inclusion of “Fortnite-esque cosmetics” and excessive repetition within the series. However, these factors will not significantly impact COD’s sales.

The analyst elaborated that Call of Duty has established a massive audience across PC and consoles, with a vast number of casual players comprising this player base. These casual players end up purchasing the game “each year out of habit and brand loyalty.” Moreover, Call of Duty’s casual player base “dwarfs” Battlefield’s, and thanks to the integration with Warzone, “millions of players are constantly exposed to marketing, in-game promotions, and social tie-ins that convert attention into purchases.”

In other news, Battlefield 6 developers have confirmed that aim assist changes are coming shortly. Additionally, here are the final PC specs for Call of Duty: Black Ops 7. What are your thoughts on Battlefield 6 selling 10 million copies? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

item.title: Battlefield 6 Aim Assist Changes Are Coming, Devs Confirm
item.content:encoded:
Battlefield 6’s console/controller design lead has confirmed that they are reverting to open beta aim assist settings.

It has been close to a month since Battlefield 6 released, and over a week since their battle royale mode REDSEC went live. Now it’s time to implement some changes and fixes to the game to enhance the overall community experience. As revealed by the devs, BF6’s console aim assist is one of the features that will receive a significant change soon.

Battlefield 6 Will Revert to Open Beta Aim Assist Settings

The confirmation about Battlefield 6’s aim assist nerf comes through a reply by the game’s console/controller design lead, Matthew Nickerson, on X (formerly Twitter). Nickerson recently responded to a post on X, which discussed BF6’s aim assist, bringing a noticeable change to gunfights, with players recognizing when they are battling against controller players. Nickerson responded to this comment, stating that “we are reverting back to OB AA settings here shortly.”

When asked how BF6’s open beta aim assist settings differ from the full release, Nickerson explained that it has “far less stickiness”, which will not create the “rotational persistence” that players are currently facing. The console design lead also explained that “recoil reduction is a separate system” from aim assist and that it will also be adjusted once the open beta aim assist settings go live. In a later reply, Nickerson also confirmed that the devs “are not resetting player’s currently set values that they have.”

In other news, here’s what Battlefield 6’s ‘take a shower‘ screen means. Additionally, a casual mode has been added to BF6 with 32 bots in each match. What are your thoughts on Battlefield 6’s aim assist receiving changes? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Escape from Tarkov’s beta rewards. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Escape from Tarkov Beta Rewards Revealed Ahead of November 15 Release
item.content:encoded:
Battlestate Games has uncovered a series of nostalgic and commemorative rewards that will be available for all Escape from Tarkov players who own the game already or who pre-order by the release date on November 15. There are extra rewards reserved exclusively for Edge of Darkness and Unheard Edition gamers.

Today marks the tenth anniversary of the first trailer released for Escape from Tarkov, and in just ten days, the game will graduate from being a beta title and will become a fully released game.

New Tarkov Rewards Coming Soon

In a post on social media, Battlestate Games uncovered a string of rewards coming to all owners of Escape from Tarkov and all who pre-order the game ahead of launch on November 15.

All Editions:

  • USEC Legionnaire Olive set
  • BEAR Sumrak Reverse set
  • Hideout Style: Echo of Battle
  • Shooting Target: Hatchling
  • PMC Dogtag: Immortal
  • Prayer Armband: Head, Eyes
  • Mannequin Poses

Extra Rewards for Unheard and Edge of Darkness:

  • Battle-Worn Gamma Container
  • Hideout Style: Forgotten
  • Prayer Armband: Loot
  • Shooting Target: Ace of Spades

Exclusive Rewards for Unheard Edition

  • Prayer Armband: SBEU KOMAR
  • PMC Dogtag: Acolyte

In a post, the head of the studio at Battlestate Games, Nikita Buyanov, said:

Today marks exactly 10 years since the very first trailer of Escape from Tarkov was released. In honor of this momentous event, we want to thank everyone who pre-ordered the game by November 15, the release date.

Make your purchase on the official website by November 15 inclusive and receive exclusive rewards on the release day. If you have already purchased the game earlier, the rewards will be added automatically.

Escape from Tarkov’s imminent release has been a long time coming – almost a decade. It marks the end of the beta stage for the game, during which countless updates have been applied, new maps have been introduced, and the community sentiment around the game has ebbed and flowed.

Are you excited about the 1.0 release of Escape from Tarkov? Let me know what you’re saying on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that Steam Deck has a new feature fans have wanted for years
